glsa.title: Bacula: Information disclosure
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in Bacula may allow local attackers to obtain sensitive information.

background.p: Bacula is a network based backup suite.

description.p: Matthijs Kooijman reported that the "make_catalog_backup" script uses the MySQL password as a command line argument when invoking other programs.

impact.p: A local attacker could list the processes on the local machine when the script is running to obtain the MySQL password. Note: The password could also be disclosed via network sniffing attacks when the script fails, in which case it would be sent via cleartext e-mail.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: A warning about this issue has been added in version 2.4.1, but the issue is still unfixed. We advise not to use the make_catalog_backup script, but to put all MySQL parameters into a dedicated file readable only by the user running Bacula.
